title: Drawing, "Diana and Callisto, Dinning Room, Palazzo Rasponi, Ravenna", 1817
title_raw: Diana and Callisto, Dinning Room, Palazzo Rasponi, Ravenna
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on cream-colored rolled paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, on recto: Camera di pranzo casa Rasponi Ravenna
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Diana seated in left middle distance, points at Callisto, who appears uncovered by three girls. More girls appear in foreground and middle distance along with two dogs. Situated under trees with distant view into valley, scene suggests rest after hunt. Verso: two pen sketches for girls, crouching one and lying one.  Inscribed above: Camera di pranzo casa/ Rasponi Ravenna.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Diana and Callisto, Dinning Room, Palazzo Rasponi, Ravenna", 1817. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on cream-colored rolled paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2249.
